ygData.subject: Is EDI SOAP?
ygData.msgSnippet: We were discussing recently how it has become popular to describe XML vocabularies in terms of the infoset instead of the XML syntax. That got me to thinking:

Subject: Is EDI SOAP?
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=us-ascii
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit
X-Filtered-By: PerlMx makes it fast and easy.  See http://www.ActiveState.com/Products/PerlMx/Header
From: Paul Prescod <paul@...>
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=23186829
X-Yahoo-Profile: papresco

We were discussing recently how it has become popular to describe XML
vocabularies in terms of the infoset instead of the XML syntax. That got
me to thinking: SOAP does not specify any message-exchange patterns. It
mandate extremely "loose" semantics. So you're allowed arbitrary syntax
and arbitrary semantics: what sort of protocol does not conform to the
SOAP model?
--
